snippet: The Takata Corporation of Japan was fined by the United States Justice Department as part of an international auto parts price-fixing investigation.
abstract: Takata Corporation, Japanese seat belt supplier, agrees to pay $71.3 million fine to settle antitrust charges, less than a month after one of its executives was sentenced to prison for fixing the price of auto parts sold in the United States and abroad.
lead_paragraph: The Takata Corporation of Japan was fined by the United States Justice Department as part of an international auto parts price-fixing investigation.

headline.main: Antitrust Fine for Supplier of Seat Belts
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Fine For Supplier Of Seat Belts
